result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn W Stenerson

records.addlTxt: Restitution Summary filed by the State
filed by the State
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement /s/ MDZ 10/04/22

9:47 AM Defendant Shawn W Stenerson in court.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Shawn W Stenerson.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Deferred Entry of Judgment agreement for 12 months.
State filed an amended complaint. 
State provides a copy of the amended complaint to Defense and Court.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Amended Count 1: No Contest.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court accepts the plea to Count 1.
Clerk directed to WITHHOLD ENTRY of  judgment of conviction this date.

Court questions Defendant.

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1:
Deferred Entry of Judgment agreement for 9 months.

Atty Pfeil addresses the Court.
Atty Gardner addresses the Court. 

Court signs the agreement.
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement filed by Atty Robert Gardner (sent to Br 1 Judge on 10/04/22 sp)
matter set for plea/sent 10/4/22 at 8:30
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice Of Consideration For A Deferred Entry Of Judgment filed by Atty Robert A. Gardner (sent to Br 1 Judge/JA on 08/17/22 sp)

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

Defendant stands mute at this time.
NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn W Stenerson in court.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Shawn W Stenerson. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on September 6, 2022 at 10:15 am.

2:14 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn W Stenerson in court.  Attorney Robert A. Gardner in court for Shawn W Stenerson. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: No contact with Walmart in Plover or be on their premises

2:26 PM Defendant Shawn W Stenerson in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant has not received a copy of the criminal complaint.
ADA Pfeil provides the defendant with a copy of the complaint.
Case is to be recalled.
2:32 p.m.  Case is recalled and appearances remain as they were earlier.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant wishes to be represented by an attorney.
Defendant is informed to go to the public defender's office today.
If he does not qualify for a public defender he can petition the court for a court appointed attorney.

State recommends a $500 signature bond with conditions as stated.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
